#summary A list of projects that use SVG-edit

  * *Integrate as-is* means that it uses some or all of the functionality of SVG-edit but it doesn't extend them. Think "SVG-edit as a finished product"
  * * Heavy modification* means SVG-edit was used as a base, but application has important changes. Think "SVG-edit as a platform/framework/starting point"

= FOSS Web apps =
Free and Open Source Web applications that you can download and install on your own server

== Integrate as-is ==
  * [http://doc.tiki.org/Draw Tiki Wiki CMS Groupware] (aka Tiki Draw)
  * [http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:SVGEdit Experimental MediaWiki extension]
  * [http://www.dokuwiki.org/plugin:svgedit Dokuwiki] (plugin)
  * [http://moinmo.in/ReimarBauer/SvgEditor MoinMoin Extension]
  * [http://www.chamilo.org/|Chamilo LMS]


== Heavy modification ==
  * [http://adityab.github.com/Awwation/ Awwation]
  * [https://code.google.com/p/cwm-drawtool/ CWM Draw Tool]


= Online services =
Directly available online, via a web browser. No need or way to download or install anything.

== Use as-is ==
  * [http://framavectoriel.org/ Framavectoriel] (in French)

== Heavy modification ==
  * [http://www.flamingtext.com/imagebot/ ImageBot]
  * [http://www.clker.com/ Clker.com] (clip art site)
  * !CloudCanvas [http://editor.cloud-canvas.com]

= Installable application =
Integrating SVG-edit in a desktop application, which you download and use on your computer.
